item.title: Report E-2025050412
item.description:
Report E-2025050412

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-16
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 16, 2025, one (1) 55-pound bag of UN3378 had a split seam due to faulty packaging and released approximately less than one (<1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the site. Before TLE could respond, R+L Carriers cancelled the response.

item.title: Report E-2025050307
item.description:
Report E-2025050307

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-14
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 14, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Activ-8 was punctured by nails and released approximately thirty-five (35) gallons of product to the trailer interior, pallets, and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbent pads and cleansers to remediate the site. Granular absorbents and hand tools were also utilized for the impacted pavement. The impacted pallet was containerized in one (1) cubic yard supersack, while the damaged drum of product was placed in one (1) 85-gallon overpack. All impacted absorbents and debris were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025050153
item.description:
Report E-2025050153

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-02
  • City: FOSTORIA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On 05/02/2025, at 16:35 hours, personnel in the CSXT Fostoria, Ohio Yard discovered SIRX525280, a loaded hopper car of Ferrous Sulfate, leaking from the A-end slide gate. The car was isolated and the shipper, SEM Minerals, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2025-05-02-00202). SPSI, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the A-end slide gate open approximately 1-2” and spilling product. Contractor personnel applied plugging material to the slide gate door to secure the leak, as it could not be closed full. The issue was identified, and corrective actions, were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Keith Mizwicki).

item.title: Report X-2025050652
item.description:
Report X-2025050652

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-01
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/1/2025 at approximately 15:45 FedEx DG Administration was notified of an undeclared dangerous goods spill at Toledo, OH station. The package was discovered leaking an unknown substance. Per the safety data sheet for this product, Nu Calgon Tri Pow'r HD, the substance was identified as UN3266 Corrosive Liquid Basic Inorganic n.o.s. The outer package was a fibreboard box that contained a FedEx Pak which contained a 3.8L plastic bottle of the liquid. The station was directed by Dangerous Goods Adminstration to contain the shipment in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2025060015
item.description:
Report E-2025060015

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-29
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0437 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at XCO. It was reported that approximately 20+ gallons (active) of Octave released from a 55-gallon DF due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer # 4416761 at dock door 80. This is an active release. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. HEPACO was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the whole area of the trailer floor and 12-foot by 12-foot area under trailer on asphalt and estimated that fifty-five (55) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. HEPACO personnel removed all cargo from trailer neutralizing cargo with soda ash and water. The trailer floor and asphalt below the trailer was neutralized with soda ash/ water and absorbent material then swept up the impacted absorbent material. The damaged drum was placed into one (1) 85-gallon overpacked drum and recovered material was placed into four (4) 55-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the XPO team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050559
item.description:
Report E-2025050559

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-29
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0153 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BCO. It was reported that approximately 16 oz of Seafoam Motor Treatment was released from a 16-oz aerosol can due to a forklift puncture by BCO a employee. The release impacted the concrete at dock door 51. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. 235755-1 – 10-gallon DF contains a 16-oz aerosol can of Seafoam Motor Treatment and oil dri.

item.title: Report E-2025050271
item.description:
Report E-2025050271

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-24
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1847 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at XCN. It was reported that approximately 1/2 gallon of Diquat spc released from 1 -gallon plastic jugs due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the concrete at dock doo 134. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. An ETA will be provided once it is known. Called Chemtrec and spoke to Chris. Report #2025042400244. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately .5 gallons of UN2927 Diquat SPC released to 3’x3’ area of the concrete dock floor due to forklift puncture. The crew deployed oil-dri onto the impacted spilled product and then cleaned with absorbents and neutralized the concrete, the pallet was cutup, impacted cardboard, poly bottles, waste was containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025050429
item.description:
Report E-2025050429

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-24
  • City: KENT
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Facility personnel showing up in the morning noticed material leaking from the back of the trailer onto the pavement. They put down absorbents to contain the material and call the companies emergency response number 0500et. A team was dispatched and arrived on scene at 1100et. The team put on the proper ppe and began addressing the release and making entry into the trailer. The container was accessed and it was found to be under extreme pressure and they backed out to regroup at 1300et. It was at this time 911 was called and the fire department/HM response team arrived. They applied water to the drum to cool it down to stop the expansion of the container. The drum was cooled down and the fire department/HM response left and was determined that the container was to be monitored overnight before placing into a salvage drum. The team monitored the temperature until 1100et on 4/25/25 at which time the drum was deemed safe to handle and place into a Salvage drum. Once the drum was placed into the salvage drum the rest of the material that was in the trailer floor and on the pavement was cleaned up and disposed of appropriately for disposal. The scene was compleat and the crews were done by 1600et.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail in a box due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail being damaged. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material and containerized the damaged pail into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040567
item.description:
Report E-2025040567

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-22
  • City: KENT
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the concrete dock floor. The terminal estimated two (2) ounces of material was released due to a forklift damaging one (1) 330-gallon poly tote. Clean Harbors used an air compressor to flip the tote over because it was on its side. Granular absorbents were deployed to the affected areas and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining product was transferred to one (1) 330-gallon poly tote. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized into one 55-gallon plastic box. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) ounces of material released from one (1) 1-gallon gallon plastic bottle due to a forklift accident that resulted in the bottle being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed absorbent pads to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040165
item.description:
Report E-2025040165

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-02
  • City: BALTIMORE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Circle K
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 60-gallons of gasoline released to a 1500 square foot area of asphalt parking lot due to the driver overfilling the tank and the the flapper, failed to engage and prevent the release of fuel. ERTS dispatched HEPACO to he site to perform cleanup. HEPACO deployed absorbents to the impacted area and containerized the collected material into four, 55-gallon metal drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050003

Report E-2025050003

  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-BCO called in to report a 2-gallon spill of UN 1993 "Sea Foam Motor Treatment" from 2 1-gallon metal cans released due to an unknown cause and impacting their trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who confirmed they were comfortable cleaning the spill with PPE per the SDS. 232505-1 - 10-gallon DM containing 1 box of 4 1-gallon metal cans of Sea Foam Motor Treatment Chemtrec# 2024040200006.
